author: omgbrick
title: republics grand army
review: Before this came out i was starting to buy multiples of the clone walker.the new gun pieces are cool ecpally the big rifle  this set has four clones  but other wise theres nothing special about this set and is basically bare bones still buy one or to with the cis battle pack

author: Chris36
title: Battle Pack - or Battle Tack?
review:
I bought 2 of these sets off S@H. They are rather overpriced compared to the droid pack, at £9 each for 58 pieces. The turret is accurate and an interesting design. The bike is nice, with 2 seats to accomodate your troops. The shocktrooper is excellent, as are the other figures. Like clones? Get this set.

5/5

author: Bran_don_jin
title: Well...
review:
Well this is...O.K. I like it due to the fact that there are 4 clone troops two of which are very rare and the new guns. I got 2 of these and I noticed something... the paint on the clones are kind of smudged I'm not really sure how to explain it. It is also expensive. I think this should be 7$ instead of 10$. Good set though, get it before they retire it.
                       8/10
P.S.If you want a GREAT set check out the new Imperial Landing Craft.

author: Jedd_the_Jedi
title: Beautiful, but is it worth the money?
review: My Dad got me this set months after I first wanted it. For some reason or another, all the clone battle packs ahd been swiped clean off shelves when around 20 of the droid variety remained. I wondered: is this set better? The odds seemed unlikely: it has a mere half the number of pieces but costs just as much as the droids battle pack, and 24.95 SGD is a tad pricey for me. However, the molding of the blasters and helmets, as well as the crazy-cool paint job on the troopers just about justifies the set. The battle station and speeder are very, very simple, but use great pieces and aren't too bad at all. It's the figs that we're after, right? This set is a dream, and, despite the awful price-per-parts ratio, is one very worth chasing.

author: david001
title: At long last!
review:
Released along with its siter product #7654 (Droids Battle Pack), this set is designed primarily for those who just want to build up their Clone forces.  The vehicles provided (1 gunnery position and the 2-seater speeder bike pictued above) only appear fleetingly, if at all, in the films but that's not really the point with this set.  

Now if only Lego would release a Stormtrooper battle pack!

author: Paul007
title: Good expansion set
review:
THis set is the bomb!! I bought two of these right off the bat and added them to my clone turbo tank.  I could care less about the red clone though.  The speeder bike is nice, but the pieces on it are even better.  You can combine the speeder bike and the gun turret to make a really cool turret, because the long poles that are on the bike work as blasters.  The guns are cool, especially the long ones.  They could put more clones in it next time though.  
Summary:  Get at least two of these while they last.  Quality is good and you won't regret the purchase.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: BETTER!
review:
If you have read my recent review on the droid battle pack you probably will have guessed I wasn’t best pleased, but this turns it all around!
The speeder design is extremely detailed, yet doesn’t seem clumsy or to large, the Clones are great as usual especially the new fitted weapons. I’m also impressed by the gun turret and the price!!!! £8.99 or $10.00! Fantastic a MUST have!

author: zinkk757
title: 3/5 for the clones
review: where is lego going with this one.  i love the clones, and the peices are ok, but compared to the droids battle pack, this one has half the peices and half the worth.  another clone should be added along with a weapons rack or something else to equalize it with the droids battle pack.  the shocktrooper is great, but why is a shocktrooper in a battle.  the speeder bike design could be better and more stable.  well, 4 troops and 50 peices uis better then nothin.  i would advice any serious star wars fans and collectors to get it.  It's good for little ones too because they can care less about the sets problems.  don't get me wrong i LOVE star wars, but this set is an insult and could use improvment.  they need to make a rebels and an imperial battle pack as well.

author: bsmarthen
title: Great
review: Love this set easy way to build an army. But you can only do so much with the yellow and red ones. I would rather have hed more just plain troopers. Still a great set and cool guns. Also one set of binoculars.

author: _add_um
title: Could be bigger
review: Not really fair price for a 58 piece set. Any way this is probaly one the most populur Star Wars sets this year. Not much to say about it, ok well nice addition to Star Wars and are first battle pack released (along with 7654). It has 4 clones with all new Star Wars blasters, an ARC Speeder Bike and a turret pod. Goes great with other sets (like 7654 and 7250) and only small problem I have with it is it's size and it should have another clone or 2 added in.

author: Manxboi24
title: Great little set
review:
This set may look small, but it is really good. Finally, we have a relatively cheap clone army builder. The speeder bike is really cool and easy to build as. The gun holder is great and easy to build. But the best part about this set is the two rare minifigs - the clone commander and the shock trooper.
 
Plus : 
* rare minifigs
* cheap army builder
* easy to build

Minus :
NONE!


Overall I'd give it a 10/10

author: hedgehog_lover
title: Not actually mine
review:
I myself don't have this set but my friend does and we played with them for a while [he also has the droids battle pack].

Pros:
speeder bike is sturdy.
Amount of troopers included.
turret is a nice touch.
NO more megaphone guns!

Cons:
helmets fall off easily.
Turret is fragile

Buy if you want a great army builder
Don't buy if you'd rather have a set where you can have a battle without buying another set.

author: Jonamaster
title: NICE!!
review:
This set is AWSOME!! 


Pros:
4 CLONE TROOPERS!!
A thing thats kinda like a speeder bike!( i changed it into a speeder bike! So did my friend)
A little thing that a clone trooper can sit behind and shoot battle droids!
A COMMANDER CLONE TROOPER!!
A RED SHOCK TROOPER!!

Cons:
None
 

if you like clone troopers, and wanna get them for cheap.. get this set!
-Jonamaster

author: legolord909
title: Who new a 58 piece set could create so much buzz.
review: This is one of my favorite sets!  It's only 58 pieces, but it's so popular!  I called up the Lego store to ask them if it was in stock.  All I had to say was Clone Troopers and the person new what set I was talking about.  Obviously, the reason for this is because of the clone troopers.  I love the red and yellow coloring!  You also get the turret and the speeder.  If you get a couple of these sets and a couple of the Droids Battle Pack sets, you can have a big battle.  They're both great army builders.  Even though they're both $10.00(USD) and the Clone Troopers Battle Pack only has about half the pieces of the Droids, I think the Clone Troopers Battle Pack is a better deal because of the Cool minifigs and the nice pieces!  5/5

author: mrmitch
title: Clone Troopers on the move
review: This set is priced well, and has four Clone Troopers (3 different designs). Priced at around $10.00 would make great gift for kids, another set would be appreciate to build up the Clone Army. Details match the movie, quick to build, lots of minifigures for the buck, you can't go wrong with this set.

author: brickbuster2409
title: the clone troopers have arrived!
review: The battle packs are some of the best ideas lego has come up with!  perfect 5 for this one simply b/c it comes with two clones, a security clone, and a commander.  great idea too including a speeder and turret.  try to get a few of these if you can.

author: sith_assassin
title: Lego should make more
review: Lego should make more of these.this is an amazing set 4 figs with guns!                                                                                                                                   Pros:                                                               4 figs                                                                new guns                                                                turret                                                                                                                                 Cons:                                                               the speeder

author: Caramel
title: NICE bike
review: This set comes with a speeder bike a gun turret and an extra clone. The speeder bike fits two clones. It has two guns attaced to the side and I think it has two guns at the front. The gun turret dose'nt have much a spot for a clone and the turret. You get 2 reguler clones, A utapau clone and a shock trooper.

author: legoguysw
title: Battle packs- Great army builders, nice addition to ANY lego star wars collection
review:
PROS
Minifigs- Clone commander/star corps trooper (teh orange one. Not Cody, though.)Shocktroopers (the red one) and 2 Troopers (standard white troopers).
Weapons- NEW blasters, 2 different sizes, 4 or 5 in total.
Battle turret- gun can fit onto top. Niceley designed with mud guards.
Speeder bike- AWESOME! Lots of lasers. Fits TWO minifigs!
The whole idea of the set- army builder, battle pack, compatible with Droid battle pack, its amazing.
CONS-
Not enough minifigs (but 4 for 9 pounds! You can buy more than one and have cash left for droid battle packs.

SO MANT PROS FOR SUCH A SMALL SET! GET IT NOW! IF YOU ALREADY HAVE IT, GET ANOTHER ONE!
Six out of 5! Thats off the scales!

author: millacol88
title: Finally some cheap clones.... now all we need are wookiee battle packs!
review:
Firstly, I would like to say that this set is simply jawdropping. It includes 2 ordinary clones, a star corps trooper, and a shock trooper. Also included is a simple but well-concieved BARC speeder and a cool turret. I got this set for christmas and I could not be happier with it. Currently I only have one but I am planning to buy two more to add to my battle of kashyyyk. There really isn't much else to say about this set other than it is great. I do have one complaint,though: mine did not come with any extra pieces, as it should. 

Pros:

-clones
-cool turret
-well designed BARC speeder

Cons: mine didn't come with extra pieces

Whats the point in even reading this review. If your a star wars fan, I know you'll get it.

author: Leggodt94
title: Average number of clones
review:
This set is...well...CHEAP! I know its inexpensive, but that's not what I'm talking. Anyways, here are some pros and cons: 

Pros: 
-comes with at least some clones 
-is the first set that comes with the new gun type 
-yellow clone and shock trooper are cool 
-includes double seat speeder bike 
-includes this awsome creative GROUND turret! 
-is inexpensive 

Cons: 
-the piece on the back of speeder doesn't hold the blaster firm enough 
-set comes with ONLY four clones 

I mean, the Republic gunship came with four clones, the AT-TE came with four clones, and the Turbo Tank only came with four clones(Kashyyyk trooper doesn't count). Over all, I really think that this set should have come with more clones. I mean, it's not like the piece count would have been to high or anything. :P

author: andy94
title: clone wars
review:
This set is beautiful.You can build a clone army.
This set contains two normal clone, one shocktrooper with binoculars and a pilot trooper.All the minifigs have new blaster guns.

Pros
-minifigs
-turret
-speeder
-price(9.99 euros)

Cons
-none

You can buy droids battle pack and create a large battle.

author: Egorredcloak
title: Cool-ish
review:
I'm shocked at the amount of people from the US complaining about the price, $10 (i.e £5) is very cheap for a set. In the UK and rest of Europe the set is double that price. I do feel cheated however, I bought the set for troopers not for some daft speeder bike which can't stand up on its own, I would have preferred one or two more clone troopers for that.
Think I will stick with my insectoids until they release a decent set of stormtroopers with proper weapons, i.e two pieces

author: Gus_263
title: Clone troopers are attacking
review: This set, one of the most cool on battle packs, and Star Wars, is so much simple, but with some useful pieces. The set includes four detailed Clones minifigures, and some weapons. The vehicle of the clones is easy to build, but also with a good system to play with. This set is make to be a battle pack, due to the quantity of figures, the vehicle design, weapons and the building system to looks like part of the clone army on the Star Wars saga. Overall the set is good designed, builted and with a considerable  number of figures, but no much pieces (includes only 58) and fun. So i rate the Clone battle pack 4/5.

author: arctrooper170
title: OK set
review:
I also bought a value with these and saved 5 more $. It is pretty good with all the clones but 10.00 for 58 pieces I mean the bionicle charge only 6.00 for 58 pieces. now the pros and cons.

PROS:
the first epi 3 clones since the turbo tank which got retired:(
the normal ones have a very good look to them
the shock troopers were some of the best clones :)
the star corps trooper is just commander cody with out the cape
the turret is kinda weird but OK (hows is it supposed to go with the speeder and clones it doesnt move)
the speeder bike is simple but put together good(doesnt take up much room)
awsome guns

CONS:
should come with more clones :)

author: Lego_Master422
title: Good starter set
review: This is a good set for anyone looking to expand a StarWars LEGO collection for a small amount of money. It comes with a fair amount of clone troopers, and best of all a shocktrooper is included. The set comes with the new blasters, which are ahuge improvement from the original ones. The speeder stays together during play, however it can, at times, be difficult to seat both clones on the speeder with their blasters. Again, this is a great set to expand a collection and great for begining builders.

author: general_veers
title: Army Builder!
review:
This is the best set to build an army of clones with

Pros
BARC Speeder
Turret
First ever Clone Shocktrooper
Star Corps Trooper
2 Normal Clone Troopers
Cheap
BARC Speeder looks really good
BARC Speeder holds 2 clones
Lovin' the turret! It looks brilliant and holds 1 clone

Cons
Should come with more clones (Maybe a couple Swamp Troopers, or a jet trooper?)
Low piece count. Its about half that of the Droids Battle Pack. So I think it should come with maybe another BARC Speeder?

Minifigs

2 Clone Troopers- I really love these
Star Corps Trooper- They are the same as the normal clones except that there is some yellow on their body and helmet
Clone Shocktrooper- The detail is immense! These are like normal clones except that there is some red on the body and helmet. Also, this is the first ever shocktrooper

Get it if-
Youre building an army

Dont get it if-
You want a set with more to build and more pieces

Playability- 9/10
Price- 10/10
Minifigs- 8/10
Accuracy- 7/10
Design- 10/10
Construction- 9/10
Accuracy to the movie- 8/10 
Overall- 9/10

author: Nikola_Bathory
title: Very good set!
review:
This is the first Lego I buy myself. Being a fan of both LEGO and Star Wars, I really like it. It inludes 4 clonetroopers (of 3 different types), they have cool blasters too (3 mormal blasters and 1 heavy blaster).
 The turret and the speeder are nothing special, but this doesn't mean that they are bad.
 The only downside - the set only contains 58 pieces, there is almost no building here. But it is clear that the minifigs are the focus of the set. I give it a 5/5.

author: DarthVader_
title: Great Set!
review: I realy like this set!  I improved the speeder bike and it is awesome!  (To see it got to the Lego gallery and type in the username: DarthVader#)  I like that it comes with four Clone Troopers, a speeder bike, and a turret!  It is awesome!

author: carl_thee_cow
title: Just what I wanted... maybe
review:
6 years ago I dreamed of this set being created and now it's here. But, it is different than my orginal vision. For one it didn't have enough clones. The speeder is a bit fimsy. But, the turret is a nice addtion to the set.

Pros:
Turret
Clones

Cons:
Speeder Bike

author: reidak49
title: army builder
review: sweet i love army builders like this one it has 4 clones 2 regular 1 yellow 1 red the turret is lame but that speeder is very amazing but it is small this set had a little more than half of the pieces of the other set

author: Da_LegoBuilder
title: Great army builder, missing things
review: 1st of all, a clone army builder, stock up to create your battalion. I bought 3 more, so now I sorta have a lopsided custom made clone army. 10 red shock troopers, 3 star corps and 6 clones. Also 4 clone pilots, and 1 scout trooper. All come with a blaster of blaster rifle. Leading my squad of clones is yoda, windu, and fisto. See what you can do with these sets? Worth your money, but the speeder bike needs to be modified. It only comes with 1 blaster rifle, however, It gives you a good variety of clones. It could have contributed to a green clone army or a scout trooper. The turret is easy to build, and If you have xtra pieces from previous sets, you may have enough to make another. for 4 clones, for $10, a great deal, and 58 peices, buy as much as you want!

author: sudorum
title: Not much to say
review: The new Star Wars battle pack sets are good for only one thing: the minifigures. Which is the only reason why I bought this set. They minifigs are somewhat special, but not so rare either. The speeder bike is basically like any other one you might get in a Star Wars set. It's nothing really special to add to your collection. The gun turret is simple, once again not anything special, but a good addition.

author: skipp
title: Clone army
review:
This is the perfect set for people trying to build an army. People interested in the speeder, not so great
The set contains One yellow clone trooper with a blaster (Starcorps?), one schock trooper with Binoclars and blaster, one clone with a blaster rifle and another clone with a blaster. It also contains a speeder and a gun turrent. So useful, i bought 4 of these, just to build my army up. Very good set

author: rwars
title: great
review:
I got 5 of these and aren’t they cool.

 I modified mine so the speeder bike has one seat.

I  also bout two droid battle packs. 
 
 i give it 4 it shoud have stuff.

 like a nother speeder bike

author: the_brickster
title: Great army builder
review:
Basically this is a meduim-small set that has 4 clones ( a shock trooper, a commandeer and 2 normal troopers), a fyling thingy-ma-jig and a turret.
PROS
-four clones
-sniper rifles
-sturdy speeder that has a gun slot.           
-turre looks great
-every one is armed
CONS
-not enough ordinary clones ( it's not that much of a problem though)
And thats it!
note:
 If you buy this and the droid battle pack you can take of the speeder guns and give them to the droids-the speeder already has one at the back.
  This is a must buy set and get it to build your army.
  9/10

author: jonbuddy
title: Most Owned Set
review:
Nothing is missing from this set: It's a great Army Builder, and it has enough clones to fit the "size" of this set.

Goods:
Yellow Clone
Red Clone
CLONES!
Speeder Bike
Turret

Bads:
nothing

Overall:
4.9/5
OR
9.9/10

By the way, it's not just the speeder bike like the picture shows, it's also a turret and 2 more clones I believe.

author: Buckbrick
title: While waiting for the NEW clone troopers battle pack...
review:
This should be going at a steal at this point in time. I got this set to get my hands on some of the older clone designs. As always, the stars of the show are the minifigs. Anyway all has been said about this set. BUT as for the speeder... Lego could have came up with a speeder similar to the one included with the Clone Turbo Tank. However, I found that the parts of the turret can be used to built a more beefed-up single seater version speeder. While I'm unsure if there are 2-seater BARCs anyway, I thought the single version I came up with looked fantastic - even more so than the awfully simplified version Lego came up with. I hope that Lego will come up with more detailed battle packs in the future.

Again, all those wonderful clone trooper minifigs!

author: LastStand
title: Best Set Ever for Army Building !
review:
Although the piece count may be low, this set provide quite a lot of playability. 

One of the best part about this set are the minifigures. 2 of them are exclusive to this set. The red and yellow clones. 

Besides these 2 minifigures, you also get 2 white clone troopers. There's also 4 brand-new 2007 blaster. 3 are short and 1 long and 1 binocular. 

The rest of the set is cool as well. You get a barc speeder bike that sits 2 and a turret which looks really nice.

The only problem I had with this set is maybe it could of have an extra white clone trooper. After all, the droid battle pack had 7 minifigures. 

Get it if you still can at your local toysrus before prices goes up cracy ! 

Would def. recommend this set. Easy to build (took 10 mins) and easy to carry around ! 

5/5 Stars !

author: Obi_Wan9994
title: Attack of the Clones!
review:
Between this and the droid battle pack, this one is my favorite.

Pros:
Shock Trooper, first set to include one.
Star Corps trooper
2 regular Clone Troopers.
BARC speeder. Has spots for 2 Clone troopers. Fantastic pieces! Great playability.
Detailed blasters. Not sure how many(sorry), but includes both long and short.
Turret. some-what detailed, fun to use, has a spot for 1 clone.
Fast, easy to build
cheap
Great with other battle packs, both clone and droid.
Fantastic Playability

Enjoy!

author: Jcc2224
title: My return to LEGO.
review: In 2007, I won a contest, I got a $50 gift card, and I got this, this was my favorite set evr, and it still is today, with a BARC Speeder and Torrent, the clones are ready for battle. This set was in 'the first volume' of SW battle packs. The Star Corps trooper is probably the best figure in this set. Even though of it's lack of pieces, this set is still fun, I think this is 10/10.

author: trumpet4751
title: Great Battle Pack
review:
The title says it all! This set is definitely worth having. Unlike some, it's also great to play with.

Pros:
- 4 clone troopers (includes rare shock trooper)
- several blasters
- speeder bike is excellent
- republic colors
- affordable, making it an easy way to buid a clone army

Cons:
- for only 58 pieces, it could be a couple dollars cheaper, but it still gets a 5/5

author: rabk295
title: Pretty good
review: This is a good set and definately the set to buy if you are making a clone army. The one thing I don't like is how the clone helmet visor is only a hole in the helmet, and it would look better painted on. Otherwise, this is a pretty cool set.

author: asianlego
title: Do The Clonetrooper Tango
review:
This set is one of the best Star Wars sets that are affordable. First, at this price you get 4 of the most coveted Star Wars army in Lego form. Who doesn't love Stormtroopers? They are perfect for dancing brickfilms (It's a running gag throughout Star Wars geeks). Only 2 of the Troopers here are the normal variety. The vehicle they ride on is also quite cool eventhough minimal building is done here.

-asianlego

author: THX_1138
title: Pretty good.
review:
This set is pretty good and well priced.
Pros:
-Reasonable price.
-Four clones in one set (including a rare 327th Star Corps trooper and a rare Shock Trooper)
-The turret is creatively built and pretty good looking.
-The bike is pretty good.
Cons:
-The bike could have been better.
-An extra Clone would have been nice, but it may have raised the price, so I'm okay with four.
If you want this for the vehicles alone, maybe you should pass, but it is a great army-building set.

author: Danblom
title: Battle the Droids!
review:
An awesome set!  First, no stickers, that makes the set enjoyable. Second, a good price, because some people (like myself) can't afford expensive sets with high minifig counts, this is a great way to go!  On with the review.

MINIFIGS:
     Pros
-Awesome clones
-"New" blasters
-Binoculars
     Cons:
NONE!

VEHICLES:
     Pros
-Good speeder
  *Sturdy
  *Playable
-Good turret
  *Great SNOT (Studs Not Only on Top) Tec.
  *Great playability

Ratings (out of 5 stars)
Value for money *****
Minifigs              *****
Overall              *****

Great Set!  Buy as many as you can!
     -Danblom <><

author: Yoda____
title: 2000 people!
review:
I'm the 2000th person to say I own this set which is pretty amazing. Anyone who complains about there not being enough clones in any set should get this one.
Those who say that there aren't enough clones in this set are just wrong.
I'm a huge fan of the turret in this set and the speeder is growing on me.
Every lego star wars fan should own this set.

author: P13c30fch33s3
title: That's it??!!
review:
I had been waiting to buy this for ages, but I was disappointed when i got it...
pros:
new guns (yay)
4 clones for a cheap price (yay)
turret (yay)
2 seat barc speeder (yay?)
um...quick build? (...)
2 normal clones (yay)
shock trooper (YAY)

cons:
not worth the money for a flimsy barc speeder (awww)

worth a 4, simply because i think lego is being stingy, but several is good value (yay)

author: kenbuild
title: send in the clones!
review:
Great army builder. I have three which makes them more fun to play with. 
Pros:
two regular clones
a shook trooper
comander cody
Pros:
the turret is bad
this is a great army building set. Buy this set now!

author: liner737
title: Clones, FIRE!
review:
pros

star corps trooper!
shock trooper!
one of the first sets with these blasters
macrobinoclulars
if you take other pieces, you can make the turret a command post

cons

speeder bike is kinda cheesy

overall this is a cool set

author: BioFreak877
title: Droids are going down!
review:
I got a couple of these sets on eBay and they are worth the $16 dollars I paid for them EACH. And here'sthe list:

Pros:
4 clones, a good assortment of colours.
A speeder.
A gun nest.

Cons:
Needs another clone, possibly a random packging colour of green, black, blue, etc.

Overall an excellent set by Lego

5/5 or 10/10

author: legofan666666
title: For the clones!
review: I wish Lego still had these in stock or brought out a new version, because this set is great! It comes with 2 regular episode 3 clones that have great detail, a red shock trooper which is extremely cool, and a yellow star corps trooper. Dont just buy this for the clones! It also includes a speeder, which is one of the most detailed speeders I have seen. It comes with a really cool battle station-type thing that you can arm with a clone. You can fit 2 clones on the speeder,one facing front and one back. A really cool feature is how on the back of the speeder you can stick the gun in a hole and it can rotate. This is the best and cheapest way to get clones!

author: es09
title: Go the 501st!
review:
This was my first set for my collection and it was awesome!


              Pros:
              Good minifigs
              New guns
              Controls for driver to hold
              Turret on the speeder


             Cons:
             Nothing

Overall this was and still is a great set.

author: Alemas
title: Brickset's most owned set... and I have it!
review:
This is a great way of getting clones! It has a speeder, turret, lots of troopers from different types, and new blasters!

Pros:

Speeder
Turret
New blasters
Troopers

Cons:

None!

Overall, a great set!

author: dk_devilkid
title: getting a bit redundant
review: As much as I like this set. I now have an overload of clones. The only droids I have are the ones from their battle pack. I now have about 30 clones. I do love the speeder bike though. It was my first one. The stationary gun is cool too. I'd say definitly get this if u dont have many (or any) clones but if you have a lot the droid pack would be better.

author: commandercody9520
title: heavy duty......but why only 4?
review:
i begged my mom for this until she let me get it off ebay.it is positively  amazing. the clones are great,espically the star corps guy. now for the pros and cons.       
                        
pros:
4 great episode 3 clones...... and with new guns! a speeder wich is excellent for spare pieces and custom made fighters.    a very nice little turret. i like the rare parts.     great army builder!

                                              cons:
why only 4 clones? the droids battle pack comes with 3 SBDs and 4 droids!

so i give this 4/5, all in all. if you see some of these, grab a few and throw in an AT-AP or a turbo tank, and you have a very tough armored assault squad.
  -commandercody9520

author: Darthleapyous
title: my first lego star wars set (and review)
review:
This is a fairly good set.If you want to buy it,get it.Here are the pros and cons:


pros:
shock trooper
2 clones
star corps trooper
turret
speeder bike


cons:
NONE! (if there's no cons, whats the point writting it)

overall:

GET THIS SET!

author: legoDad42
title: Good Starter for Kids!
review:
I find ALL the 'battle-packs' Lego puts out are perfect to get your kid into Lego. Don't go too large with the models at first but instead pick up these clone battle packs or droid battle packs. Very easy builds for a 5 yr. old on up. 

This particular set comes with 4 Clone Troopers, a gunner station and a neat speeder-bike with a mount to put a blaster in the rear. You also get a set of binoculars for one of your Clones. I believe one of the Clones has a yellow stripe on his helmet (indicating a pilot) and one with a red stripe (indicating a 'shock' trooper or officer).

author: chavez247
title: Fantastic Purchase
review:
This is a great set and a wonderful army builder, making it a must-have for someone who wants to build a clone army. It comes with four clones(all of episode three design), a small(but impressive) speeder bike, and a gun turret.
There are four figures: a Shock Trooper, a Star Corps Trooper, and two regular clone troopers. I actually got two Shock Troopers, because my dad ordered one along with the set. The Shock Troopers are great, with a mixture of red and white, and both come with a blaster rifle. The Star Corps Trooper has some yellow markings on his helmet and torso, and the two regular clones are completely white(albeit the obvious black marks). All the figures are very neat, and all come with at least one blaster or blaster rifle.
The speeder is small but nice. It can seat two people, one to drive and one to shoot. There are two small megaphone blasters on either side of the speeder. There are three "engine" pieces: one at the front of the speeder and two on either side of the end. Eventually, the speeder is made up of two parts: the main body where the clone troopers sit and a small, thin front, made up of an engine, a couple of base plates, and two long "cannon" pieces.
The gun turret is nothing special. It has a small piece on top in which a blaster can be put in. Then it`s got a base plate for the gunner to stand on.
Pros:
Good figures
Shock Trooper is unique
Impressive speeder
Speeder seats two
Good army builder
Gun turret
Cons:
Perhaps one more regular clone?
Overall, this is a great set and a great army builder. Get it if you can.
I hope you found my review helpful.

author: LEGOwikiguy
title: Clones speed off to double amount of Droids...
review:
This set is the best way to get Clone Troopers from Revenge of the Sith! I give it a 4.5/5. The set goes very well against the Droids battle pack, and the updated BARC speeder is great. Pros and Cons:

Pros:
1. Good starter set for younger LEGO Star Wars fans
2. Diversity of Clone Trooper classes
3. Speeder fit for two
4. New engine pieces are amazing!
5. TURRENT!

Cons:
1. Double the droids in a battle for this
2. Turrent standing is kind of awkward, but other than that, this set has almost no cons

I recommend this set, especially to younger LEGO fans who want so good figures!

author: EtudeTheBadger
title: No-one messes with the 501st...
review:
The second of LEGO's rather cool battle packs, this one features some new and old clone trooper figures. The new troopers in question are the Coruscant Shock Troopers (with red trim). The older figures are plain clone troopers and the Star Corps troop that originally came with the Clone Juggernaut in 2005.

I love the new troops as well as the old, and the fact that LEGO finally came up with this idea- figures for a relatively cheap price as well as a few trinket vehicles that are useful for parts. I bought three of these sets at Argos to add to my army, and the speeder parts are useful for MOCs and modifications.

Possibly the only bad things I can say about this set is the price- 9.00 quid? A little steep, I think. Also, the speeder is a little bland and offers little opportunity for parts usage in other applications.

Nevertheless, a good buy, and get in bulk if you can.


-maaboo35

author: jookball
title: good value for money
review:
I think this is a great value for your money. I think that for $10 you get good clones and a speederbike.


pros:

minifigs

speeder


cons:

not enough parts

author: awesomestudios
title: Best.  Set. EVER.
review:
Before i get to the pros and cons, i should say that LEGO should remake all episode three sets they ever made, because I think that this new junky "clone wars" stuff that they're handing us is no good.  anyway, here are the pro's and cons.

Pros:

  • Shock trooper
  • Star Corps Trooper (No he's not a commander)
  • 2 regular phase 2 troops

Cons:

  • Could have had another regular trooper
  • BARC speeder isn't realistic

author: legodude357
title: So far, My favorite Battle Pack.
review:
Yes, currently this is my favorite battle pack. I recently rebuilt the figures, and in my opion they look much better than the new clone wars sets being released now. I'm trying to build the speeder and the turret, as this is a great set and great value for money. 

Box/Instructions

The box is nothing special, and the instructions were flawless. No mistakes.

Parts

The parts included were quite rare/uncommon. And are great to add to your collection. Espicially the release of the new blasters this set came with.

Minifigures

The reason you buy battle packs is for the figures. These, are great! I like them better than the newer figures in the clone wars sets now. I hope to find some more helments and construct some more.

The build

The build is quick and dull. Nothing much to say.

The completed model

The completed model is for playability not display. And it is very fun to swoosh around. And you could make two squads  of clones, the shock trooper and a white clone then the star corps clone and a white clone, then have a battle. It is even more fun with the droid battle pack or another one of these sets.

Summary

This is a discontinued set but you could buy one off Amazon for about $30 USD. Which I think I'll do because this is one of my favorite battle packs and is a great value for money. Thanks for reading!

author: PaulTR
title: Bring In the Clones!
review:
This set caught my eye, as it was one of the first SW battle pack sets released. I bought it at my local Walmart at 20% reduced price; I have played with it regularly since then, and am very pleased I made the purchase.

 

The 7655 is a decent looking set. The BARC speeder looks nice, if a bit too simplistic; the older BARC speeder from the original Clone Turbo tank is much superior to this iteneration, in my opinion. Also, the little turret, while a nifty little design, is nothing mind-blowing. Buuuuut, with that being said, this set is marketed as a minifig army building set, so you can't really get indignant at LEGO for not including massive tanks or huge turrets. Also, the figs do look nice: the Shocktrooper's armor is a lovely shade of red, and even his back sports a bit of red detailing. The rare clone commander, while not a new fig, is also a great addition with his yellow detailing and small, printed command pauldron. Overall, this set is not a complete bummer when it comes to appearences, although I will say its opposing set, the Droid Battle Pack, has much better-looking "vehicles."

 

The building time and techniques for this set were quick and simple. The BARC speeder can be thrown together in as little as a minute, while the turret can be made faster than it takes you to put on your socks (don't quote me on that, though ;) Of the two, I actually like the turret's build better than the speeder; the turret uses a nifty little wheel-hub piece to get a nicely curved stand. By comparison, the speeder is a platform with some engine pieces and X-wing lasers thrown on it. But at least you get some very useful parts, such as engine blocks, Republic Red pieces, and 4 (when released) new blasters. However, this does not change the fact that you only get 58 pieces with the set, meaning the set is more appropriate as a $5 US dollar set rather than a $10 US dollar set. I think the price would have been a bit more justifiable if there were 5 clones instead of 4, and they were equipped with some extra guns or accessories. But on the other hand, Episode 3 clones were/are a bit hard to come by, so this set includes some fairly rare SW figs.

 

This set is decently fun to play with, although there are no "action" features. You can load up 2 clones on the BARC speeder to conduct recon missions, and you can swivel the turret's little blaster. Besides that, there's not much else to do. But once again, the clones save the day! Since there are 4 of them, they make a nice little squad; to tell the difference between the two standard clones, I usually give one of them the larger blaster and the other one the smaller blaster. You can have lots of fun sending the clones on missions against their opposing 7654 Droid Battle Pack enemies (if you have that set), but I just feel the set could've done with some extra features. I would even have been fine if LEGO threw in a flick-fire missile on the turret, so you could at least have some action feature; as it stands, this set actually has the least "action" features out of any of the SW battle packs, so I must rate the playability very low:( All righty, let me hit the list!

Pros:

  • -Clones look very cool, especially the rare clone commander
  • -Turret design is interesting
  • -Includes rare Episode 3 clones
  • -Useful pieces, such as engine parts and blasters

Cons:

  • -Very simplistic
  • -A bit pricey
  • -No action features
  • -Hardly any accesories

All in all, I would recommend this set to die-hard SW fans and army builders looking for Ep. 3 clones, but not really anybody else. The lack of pieces, lack of action features, and general simplicity of the vehicle set it a bit further back in the pack when compared to other battle packs. Still, the clone figs do a good job of salving the wound, so the set isn't a total loss; after all, who couldn't use more clones :)

author: cobrayen
title: amazing
review: good set overall.the rare mini figs are amazing.turrets awesome.speeders a little off.goes good with the droids battle pack.if you got this set, lucky you.its discontinued right now.this is the only set that has a star corps trooper(as far as i know).the shock trooper is only in one other set,but the legs are a little bit different.if your a collector or are just starting out,this is a very good set.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Jedi Need Clones
review:
Set #7655 Clone Trooper Battle Pack: Once again I am quite impressed by a battle pack offering in that it is one of the better bargains out there. For all you LEGO Star Wars troop builders, rejoice, for LEGO has done it again.

 

This set includes two buildable items, a small weapons platform for the Shock Trooper and a two man BARC Speeder. (I assume it is a BARC Speeder.) The pieces used aren't too new from what I can see, and the construction is simple and fun, but I think the real attention grabber from this set is in fact the Mini-Figures.

 

There are a few curiosities about this set. First of all, rather than give a regular steering handle piece LEGO uses two small black individual pieces (not sure what they're called) to make a steering device that concievably falls apart quite easily. Also, the Clone piloting this thing can't store his blaster anywhere. So he's holding his blaster while driving, not exactly proper Speeder etiquette for Clone Troopers. (LOL)

 

LEGO gave us the new blaster pieces in this set, but not the Droids Battle Pack, an odd choice, but I assume it was so they could include more Mini-Figures in the set. (Depending on cost of Droid body parts compared to new blaster pieces.) Four clones does not an army make, but buy three or more of this bad boy set and you're set up with a little defensive perimiter for your larger Clone sets.

 

The printing on the clones is nice too, with unique coloring for two of them to give us the Shock Trooper and... a Clone Commander? I believe all four of them were double-sided torsos as well.

 

Overall I'd say this set is definitely worth picking up. The Clones don't have any individual faces, but that isn't really a must have, I think five Mini-Figures in total might have made a slightly better option for Troop Building, but then again Four is an even number whereas five is uneven... So I guess it's a toss up. I highly recommend this set to every LEGO Star Wars enthusiast, even if you can only get one it will enhance your larger Clone sets, including the Clone Turbo Tank or AT-OT Walker quite nicely. Every battlefield needs a defensive perimiter to deal with pesky assassin or infiltration units.

author: Zman_2300
title: Awesome set!
review: Really cool set!  But my yellow clone trooper came out of the box with a chewed up head. (same with my friend)  So a little disappointed about him.  (tell me if you had the same problem)  But overall really cool.  One thing is that the BARC speeder is not realistic.  You can get a new and upgraded one in set 7913

author: psychman7
title: Star Wars Set #2: 7655 Clone Troopers Battle Pack
review:
This was one of the Lego Star Wars sets I got for Christmas back in 2007. I got this along with #6205 V-wing Fighter, #6212 X-wing Fighter, and #7658 Y-wing Fighter. I must say, this set is a rather good opponent for set #7654 Droids Battle Pack, which I had acquired a few weeks before this.

Box/Instructions:
Both the box and instructions are the same size as #7654. But it's a battle pack, so I suppose that much is obvious. The design of the box is good, it looks like these clone troopers are kickin' butt. The instructions were easy enough to understand.

The Pieces:
There were some interesting pieces, and at the time the blaster pieces were new at the time, so it was nice to get those as opposed to the stupid-looking megaphone pieces that were used from 1999 to 2006. Coincidentally, those pieces are used on the speeder bike.

The Minifigures:
If you want a good set of Episode III clone troopers to start off your collection, then this is definitely the set for you. Although the redesign from 2010's #8091 Republic Swamp Speeder (which I do not own) is much better than the first, it's a fairly decent design of the clone trooper seen from Episode III. They are very well designed and I sincerely hope they remake them in the years to come.

The Turret:
...It's okay, I guess. The mounted gun is a nice feature, but that's really the only thing. It can fit a clone to shoot down some droids from the ground. The wheel fairing pieces we all see in Lego City sets are used in an interesting way, so that's a plus. Overall, not too great.

The Speeder Bike:
I remember all the speeder bikes that appeared in Star Wars Episode III, and I don't quite recal any of them having two clones (one facing front driving, the other on the back with a mounted turret). Don't get me wrong, it's a very nice speeder, and the guns below the handlebars are cool, but if the set included a BARC speeder as shown in the movies, that would've maybe scored more points.

The Final Verdict:
Pieces - 10/10 - The blaster pieces are much better than the old megaphone pieces for guns.
Minifigures - 9/10 - Some great clones, but the redesign in 2010 was way better
Turret - 4/10 - Yes, seems harsh, but does it do anything really?
Speeder Bike - 8/10 - Well designed, but was never in the films, so I had to dock points there.

Final result - 7.75/10. Not great, but again a good starter.

author: CLMF
title: Nothing Special
review:
Just giving my 2 cents on this set that I have.

Box/Instructions

The Clone Troopers Battle Pack has a box that appears to show a lot of action on the art. There's nothing special compared to other sets in that year.

Parts

There are 58 parts in this set, there's nothing special except for the blasters which were new at the time.

Minifigures

This battle pack comes with 4 minifigures: 2 normal clones, 1 Star Corps Clone, and 1 Shock Trooper. All of them come with front and back printing, which seems fairly accurate. Unfortunately, there is no leg printing or faces on the heads, which are all black. These figures would be good but the new Phase 2 troopers are much better.

The build

The build was very short, emphasis on short, not much to note here.

The completed model

I find that the model is not very stable, especially the speeder. Mine falls apart very often.

Overall opinion

Playability: 7/10 Fairly swooshable, but there is nothing for the Clone Troopers to shoot.

Design: 5/10 Breaks all the time, like I mentioned before.

Price: 9/10 $10 for a battle pack is great!

Minifigs: 6/10 Overshadowed by the new clone troopers.

Overall: 27/40

author: Tar_Domo
title: The Battle Of Kashyyyk Continues
review:
This is a set from 2007.

Parts

- Some interesting kind of exclusives but overall not a lot of parts.

Minifigures

- Nice 4 Clone Troopers: A Star Corps Clone Trooper (has orange printings), a Shock Trooper (has red printings) and 2 basic phase 2 Clone Troopers.

The completed model

This is a good set for play, okay for play. Best for building an army.

Overall opinion

I recommend this set for Episode 3 collectors and Clone Army builders. It´s a good battle pack to both, kids and collectors.

author: lego_by_ben
title: Nice Old Battle Pack
review: I had this set and recently rebuilt it, so now I will write a review for it. Overall I rated it a 4, because it's a fun and simple set that brings me to simpler times. It's also great for building armies 10 years ago. Building experience is the worst factor, it's very simple, but the turret looks nice. The speeder looks less cool, but it isn't horrible. I rated parts a 2, because it only has 58 pieces, with only 37 actually going into the actual models! Back in the day, most people probably weren't buying these for the builds or pieces. I rated it a 4 on playability, because the turret is fun to put the Shock trooper in and his rifle, and allowing him to blast away at droid enemies. The speeder is also pretty swooshable, and it seats two clones, allowing you to perhaps drop one off at the battlefield and race away to pick up another. The minifigs are great too. They are all classic phase 2 clones. Two are normal clones, one's a shock trooper, and one is a star corps clone. These clones are the main reason you'd buy the set. Value for money is a 3 from me because the clones make it worth its price (MSRP). It's a good set, but I would just recommend you buy the clones seperately from Bricklink and maybe piece together the rest of the set I you want the build. It's not worth it to buy it on eBay or similar sites.

author: shady40
title: Good, but not as a single set
review:
The whole set is pretty enjoyable with other sets from 3rd episode, but kinda lacks playability as a single set (Basically nothing to do with it), so I strongly recommend using this set eg. to fill empty seats in sets like 7671 AT-AP Walker or 8091 Republic Swamp Speeder with its minifigures.

Pros:

- Nice set of minifigures included

- Low price

Cons:

- Lacking playability as a single set

- Poorly designed speeder, results in low durability
